reviews.title: Knockout!
reviews.text: Beautiful building/interesting background regarding founder - great location in Beaune and, of course, those multi colored tile roofs typical of Burgundy.

reviews.title: Worth a visit.
reviews.text: Well worth a visit. Very interesting. But don't be conned into buying the pack of 3 venues, it's not what you might think it is. It's not the wine tasting....it's the wine museum.

reviews.title: Exceeded all expectations
reviews.text: Off course if you visit Beaune, you visit the Hotel Dieu. We’d been lent a book about it before we went, but were still knocked out by the place.

reviews.title: Soo interesting.
reviews.text: The story behind its original construction and continued use over several centuries is heart warming. The history and way the many rooms have been laid out is explained in the audio guide – which is included in the 7 Euro entrance. We neither dawdled nor hurried, but the time passed quickly. We must have spend nearly two hours there and left still with a sense of wonder to look for some Burgundian refreshments.

reviews.title: Amazing place
reviews.text: The history attached to the hospice and the foresight of its founder along with just its existence make this a fascinating place to visit.

reviews.title: Must not be missed
reviews.text: Amazing history, do the audio tour. Beautiful building. The history is amazing, the audio tour was excellent and well organized. Beaune is a very luxurious destination, it was nice to counterbalance all the wine and food with history and a bit of humanity. Please don't miss this, it was one of the highlights of a 2 week trip in Europe.

reviews.title: Beautiful and Interesting
reviews.text: A stunning building - incredible roof and general design. Could not believe its historic significance. Well worth a visit, and a perfect way to spend a couple of hours in Beaune for a respectable entry fee. This suited us well on a rainy day!

reviews.title: Nice affordable one hour visit
reviews.text: Very informative and lovely building. Very educational, especially for those in the medical field or just interested in history. A nice change from the typical museum.

reviews.title: Extraordinary
reviews.text: The design and planning of this hospital in the 13th century was so far ahead of its time as to amaze. The wards are spacious,the kitchen ahead of its time and the entire design a tribute to all those who created it. There is a detailed description of each facet of its operations from the wards, the history of its construction. the life of the nuns, the operation of the kitchen and pharmacy etc. An immensely impressive structure of huge historical importance

reviews.title: A not-to-be-missed masterpiece
reviews.text: The Hôtel Dieu, even called Hospice de Beaune, has been founded around mid of XV century by the Duke Nicolas Rolin, a benefactor that wanted to create an hospital for poor people. Along the years, even rich people were hosted in the Hôtel, against payment of a daily rate, that was used to finance the hospital.

reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.text: Such a wonderful place to visit. A lot of history, the audio guides are well designed and give plenty of information. Just walk around and enjoy all those rooms, they are just beautiful. The place worth a visit and please do stop in the main courtyard it is magic, the roofs are stunning. The last part with the famous painting is superb. We loved it .....

reviews.title: Superb
reviews.text: Such a beautiful piece of French history. The museum is beautiful. Guides or audio guides are very well done and give a lot of information about the place. The visit last over 1 hour without rushing. It is very clean, the last part with the painting is stunning. We loved it.....

reviews.title: Fascinating insights to 15th century foresight
reviews.text: Excellent English audio guide to this interesting piece of French, Burgundy and medical history. Well worth the few Euro entry fee.

reviews.title: Interesting, But a Little Over the Top
reviews.text: Interesting place, with a unusual slant on the history of Burgundy (after all, churches and castles are the typical tourist site, not a hospital). Unfortunately, the audio guide was a little too self congratulatory to be believable.

reviews.title: Wonderful place!
reviews.text: If you visit Beaune you must see the Hospice de Beaune, a very beautiful building with an interesting history behind.

reviews.title: Excellent museum with audio guide
reviews.text: The entry price (7euros) includes an audio guide.

reviews.title: unexpected
reviews.text: The visit is then very interesting.

reviews.title: Interesting
reviews.text: Beautiful museum, beautiful buildings.

reviews.title: The best historic museum I've seen
reviews.text: A Must see in Beaune!

reviews.title: An abstract of Burgundy
reviews.text: A must see. You will be wowed by what you see and hear about this hospital. A very humanitairian place and beautiful.
